seniority_level.evidence: Title includes 'Data Engineer' but no explicit seniority level (e.g., junior, mid, senior) is mentioned. The Korean term '(모델링)' suggests a modeling specialty but does not clarify seniority. Years of experience are not specified in a normalized way.

job_family.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Data Engineer', and responsibilities focus on data pipelines, modeling, and infrastructure.

sub_specialty.evidence: Title includes '(모델링)' (modeling), and description emphasizes data modeling, pipeline design, and data quality.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Mentions mentoring ('고객과 입점 브랜드가 개인의 성공을 자유롭게 표현할 수 있도록'), code reviews, and technical leadership without explicit people management duties.

primary_cloud.evidence: No cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) or cloud services explicitly mentioned in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Mentions CDC (streaming/real-time) and '다양한 소스로부터 데이터' (diverse data sources) alongside workflow managers like Airflow (batch).

orchestrator_category.evidence: Lists modern orchestrators (Dagster, Prefect) as preferred alongside Airflow/Luigi, but no explicit primary orchestrator is stated.

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions Databricks ('데이터 품질 플랫폼(Great Expectations, Soda 등)과 Databricks 기반 데이터 웨어하우스 환경') and data quality tools (Great Expectations, Soda) which are commonly associated with lakehouse architectures.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location is stated as Seoul, South Korea, but no explicit remote work restrictions (e.g., same country, timezone) are mentioned beyond the exclusion of KR in Pass 1 extraction, which is likely a misinterpretation of the original posting's location.

timezone_focus.evidence: No timezone requirements or team distribution details are provided.

relocation_required.evidence: Job posting is located in Seoul, South Korea, and mentions '입사지원 시점으로부터' (from the point of application) without explicit relocation requirements.

h1b_friendly.evidence: No H1B sponsorship mentioned, and job is based in South Korea where H1B is irrelevant.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of OPT/CPT or student visa support, and residency in South Korea is implied.

citizenship_required.evidence: No citizenship or work authorization requirements explicitly stated for South Korea.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: No contract type (W2, C2C, 1099) or employment type mentioned, as these are US-specific and not applicable in South Korea.

benefits_level.evidence: Mentions a 3-month probation period with full benefits after ('입사지원 시점으로부터 3개월간의 수습기간 이후 채용확정'), but no details on premium benefits like equity or learning budgets.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions '고객과 입점 브랜드가 개인의 성공을 자유롭게 표현할 수 있도록' (supporting individual success) and '성장할 수 있는 데이터 인프라' (growable data infrastructure), but no explicit career tracks are outlined.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions collaboration with senior engineers ('시니어 엔지니어와 협업') and technical leadership without formal mentorship program.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions or advancement paths.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal mobility or role changes.

career_tracks_available.evidence: Mentions '시니어 엔지니어' (senior engineers) and '데이터 인프라의 기술적 방향' (technical direction of data infrastructure), but no explicit management or specialist tracks are discussed.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Distinguishes between must-have ('SQL, Python, 데이터 파이프라인, CDC, Databricks') and nice-to-have ('data modeling, Airflow, Luigi, Dagster, Prefect, Great Expectations, Soda') skills with balanced language.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description focuses on data engineering tasks (pipelines, modeling, quality) with a clear emphasis on Databricks and CDC.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Must-have skills align with typical data engineering roles, and no unrealistic expectations (e.g., 10+ years for mid-level) are detected.
